Cuerpo: Date: Tue, 10 Dec 1996 23:13:59 GMT Server: NCSA/1.4.2 Content-type: text/html Last-modified: Thu, 06 Jun 1996 18:08:40 GMT Content-length: 5482 Resume for Lauren Bricker Resume for Lauren Bricker Computer Science & Engineering Department, University of Washington, FR-35, Seattle, WA 98195 USA Phone: (206) 543-7798 Interests Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Supported Cooperative Work (CSCW), Computer Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL), computer graphics and animation. Experience 1994 - present Senior Software Engineer Ark Interface , Seattle, WA Assisted in the redesign and implementation of Packard Bell's Navigator 3.x. Was soley responsible for design and implementation of the Game Room. Implementation in Microsoft Visual C++. Kidspace, Workspace and Navigator are Ark's document-centered graphical user interfaces for Microsoft Windows. 1993 - present Research Assistant University of Washington, Seattle, WA Mathematics Experiences Through Image Processing (METIP). Applications are written for Microsoft Windows using the Borland Object Windows Library (OWL), Microsoft Visual C++ and Visual Basic. Ported the Simulation, Analysis and Modeling (SAAM) II program from Sun/Open Windows to Microsoft Windows using Visual C++. Designed and implemented an application program interface (API) and common dialog boxes for Ark Kidspace and Wrokspace, written in Visual C++. Designed and implemented enhancements to the user interface portion of FileShare, a distributed network file manager for Microsoft Windows. Assisted in the design and implementation of the user interface portion of SuperTrap, an office management database on the Macintosh for a translation bureau in Zurich, Switzerland. 1990 - 1993 Software Engineer Adonis Corporation, Bellevue, WA (now ConnectSoft ) Contracted to Space Labs Medical. The application was written in Visual C++ using the Microsoft Foundation Classes. Also edited Quick Clips, an Adonis newsletter for Window Shopper customers. 1987 - 1988 Software Engineer Caddex Corporation, Woodinville, WA Member of a small team developing a networked desktop publishing product for Microsoft Windows. Ported the spelling checker, hyphenation, and thesaurus code written by Proximity Technology, Inc from MS-DOS to Windows. 1985 - 1987 Software Engineer Boeing Company, Seattle, WA Defined software requirements for the Flight Path Management and Navigation functions of the Advanced Tactical Fighter project. Education 1990 - present University of Washington,  Seattle, WA Received Masters of Science Degree in Computer Science and Engineering in December, 1993. GPA 3.5  / 4.0. GPA 3.6 / 4.0.
